definition: of or relating to electronics or to devices, circuits, or systems developed through electronics.
the science that deals with the material universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.
the inhabitants of this planet, especially the human inhabitants
a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and meeting the circumference or surface at each end.
a mark or stroke long in proportion to its breadth, made with a pen, pencil, tool, etc., on a surface:
any of various instruments for writing or drawing with ink or a similar substance.
one of the large feathers of the wing or tail of a bird.
any warm-blooded vertebrate of the class Aves, having a body covered with feathers, forelimbs modified into wings, scaly legs, a beak, and no teeth, and bearing young in a hard-shelled egg.
either of two bones, the mandible or maxilla, forming the framework of the mouth.
a narrow cleft with steep, rocky walls, especially one through which a stream runs.
a deep valley with steep sides, often with a stream flowing through it.
